6:["$","section",null,{"className":"py-16","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"container mx-auto px-4","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"max-w-3xl mx-auto","children":[["$","h2",null,{"className":"text-3xl font-bold mb-6","children":["About ","Buenos Aires Province"]}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground text-lg leading-relaxed","children":"Buenos Aires Province is the economic powerhouse of Argentina, home to nearly 40% of the country's population. While CABA gets all the attention, the province offers compelling alternatives for expats who want proximity to the capital without the price tag. La Plata — the planned capital city with its striking cathedral — offers a university-town vibe at half the cost of CABA. Mar del Plata provides beach life year-round. The northern suburbs (Tigre, San Isidro) offer green spaces and river access just 30 minutes from downtown BA. The Pampas heartland is gaucho country — vast estancias, weekend asados, and a pace of life that's the antithesis of city living."}]]}]}]}]
